page.title: 03Housing on Kilvey Hill
page.content: Riflemans Row and Taplow Terrace are two rows of small terraced houses which date from the mid-nineteenth century. They were buiit by local industrialists for men who worked in their metal works. Many of them have been modernised. Gwyndy Road is made up of semi-detatched council houses which are traditional in design. These houses were built about 30 years ago. During the last 10 years many new council houses have been built to a more modern design. These newest houses have been built where there were once{'prefabs'.} The 'prefabs' were built after the Second World War as a quick way of providing homes for all the people who had been bombed out.
